data.title: Stay at hotel
data.text: Had procedure at clinic on back was close so had shuttle me to appt. shuttle got me to the appt on time, and helped me in and out of van.  Great service. I would stay again if have to be at appt at regions

data.title: Great hotel for a business trip.
data.text: Breakfast and Happy Hour were wonderful. Staff are very polite and happy. Windows in the room are a little drafty and hard to control temp, but otherwise a great hotel! Nice workout room. Glass elevators and ducks with the water features help make this hotel beautiful and classy.

data.title: Love the Embassy Suites in downtown Saint Paul!
data.text: I've stayed here several times for both business and pleasure and the level of service has always been excellent. My room was well cared for and the staff is very welcoming. I love the free shuttle in the downtown area also - makes it so nice that I don't have to drive or walk if the weather is inclement. Always recommend this wonderful hotel!

data.title: Customer reception = customer interrogation and tolerance
data.text: Customer reception = customer interrogation and tolerance but with exceptional front desk service. Very slow elevators. Nice atrium. Nice workout facilities. Location is a little remote compared to other downtown facilities

owner_response.author: SalesManager175, Manager at Embassy Suites by Hilton St. Paul - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi John-

Our greatest apologies for your personal experience at the evening reception. We want to make sure that all of guests feel welcomed and appreciated for their business. Please follow up with Karin at 651.379.5054 so we can better understand the occurrence and address it with our staff  . Thank you for being a Hilton Honors Loyalty Member and for the review. 

Thank You!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Nice stay
data.text: The Hotel is very good, it is older hotel, but is kept up, location is kinda off the beaten path, service was good but there was some confusion during the check in it took three personal to check men in ...

data.title: great place to stay
data.text: Rooms were clean and updated. It was quiet. Breakfast was better than average and I'd actually prefer it over going to eat at most diners.  The only thing that I would have to say is that the room was quite warm and I'm not sure that the air was working (granted it is November and it was unseasonably warm outside).  The breakfast attendant made our stay.  If you see her clearing tables, strike up a conversation.  You will not be disappointed.  She was truly a joy!

data.title: A Great Stay
data.text: A very nice hotel.  Clean rooms and typical Embassy Suites layout.  A great managers reception and a great breakfast.  Clean and quiet and a restful stay.  I have nothing bad to say about this property.  Self parking was $16.00 per night.

data.title: Great Stay
data.text: This is a great hotel.  The breakfast is outstanding.  They also have what I would call snacks in the evening.  Pepsi products.  Elevators are very slow but are all glass so it makes for a cool view.  The interior atrium area is very relaxing.  Overall good stay.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text: Very nice but expensive.  Internet and parking NOT included.  Not an expectation of a top-tier hotel.  Wonderful breakfast.  The in-house pub was so-so but again, pricy.  I kind of felt held-up after I purchased a room.

owner_response.author: SalesManager175, Manager at Embassy Suites by Hilton St. Paul - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Richard-

Thank you for the review and sorry you were dissatisfied with the price. There are always different factors that can impact a guest room rate, unfortunately parking and internet is not included. If you are travel frequently and are loyal to the Hilton Brand,  I would suggest signing up for Hilton Honors which is Free! This way you will receive complimentary internet + Points for future travels.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Romantic Overnight
data.text: We stayed here on our way home from a sad trip to say good-bye to my dying father-in-law. Needless to say, our spirits were low. The friendly greeting at check-in, the beautiful suite, and the amenities made this a wonderful stay.

data.title: Manager did take care of me afterwards.
data.text: I want to say that Hilton group DOES take care of customers' concerns seriously. I am satisfied with the service and the response they provided to me during 2014 complaint. I am still a loyal member to Hilton Groups.

data.title: Terrific service
data.text: Staff was incredibly helpful.  If you looked closely, the building was showing a little wear and tear, but it was clean and the staff were terrific.  My room was clean and well-appointed, the bed was comfortable, whatever we needed for our meeting room was quickly made available and I had a great stay.

data.title: Joe with a bow!
data.text: This hotel was made great by Joe! Exceptional customer service.  He goes above and beyond.  As a Hilton member I have never ran across anyone who makes your stay better!  Hilton make this man the CEO! The room itself is in need of remodel. However with Joe everything was fine. It's all about how your treated.

data.title: Does not meet Hilton standards
data.text: As a Hilton Gold member, I love the Hilton brand because 98% of the time you can expect cleanliness, comfort and friendliness. This hotel has none of these. The room is moldy, keeping myself and son awake with asthma, it is hot and stuffy (A/C does not work, they are in the "warming" season right now), there is bloody gauze under one bed, there was a spider in the bathroom, it probably came out of the hole in the wall by the shower head and they just put caulk over existing mold. There is an ambulance repeatedly passing by and a fight just broke out. We are in a premium room where there are supposed to be free "vending" machines for snacks and beverages, I was rudely told with inconsistent dates that they were taken out (they're still on the website) and replaced with the snacks in the room, which consists of 1 each of 4 different sodas, a water and a juice and a basket with a few snacks, again 1 each. I stress the 1 each because the reservation asks how many children and I honestly stated 4. As any parent knows, having 1 type of something and 4 little children after a long car ride is like throwing 1 fish into a pool filled with sharks...there will be blood. When I brought up Hilton's motto of, "We'll make it right," the woman claiming to be the manager instantly stated, "We are independently owned and operated," with both hands up in the air.  There are so many other Hilton brand hotels in this area...stay away from this one!!!!!

owner_response.author: SalesManager175, Manager at Embassy Suites by Hilton St. Paul - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Heidi-

Thank you for the review and thank you for being a Hilton Honors Loyalty Member. Although you did not have a positive stay, we appreciate the response so we can work on the these areas with our staff. I greatly apologize we did not make it right for you and your family and you did not receive a better response. Please feel free to contact Karin in the sales department to further follow up. 651.379.5054
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Woman's Conference
data.text: We stayed one night as we were in town for a conference.  Front desk did not inform us of the amenities. After conference when asking for a local place to eat, front desk was not helpful, we ended up eating at motel, as we were told everything else was closed. Being in downtown St. Paul on a Friday night I doubt this was true.

data.title: Surprisingly Beautiful Hotel
data.text: This hotel has the most beautiful lobby and room layout - it felt boutique. The managers reception and breakfast were good quality as well. Staff was friendly - I've stayed in Hiltons before but this one was above average. Easy to get to off the highway and plenty of food and bars within walking distance

data.title: Embassy Suites lives up to #1 ranking
data.text: Recent surveys have rated Embassy Suites #1 for business travelers.  My three visits to this hotel in Minneapolis affirms these results.  Excellent experience and great breakfasts. Unfortunately, I have not been able to enjoy the evening refreshments due to my business meetings but at some point look forward to it.

data.title: Not to Hilton’s Standard.  I suggest choosing another property
data.text:
As a gold hhonors member, I retain a lot of brand loyalty when traveling for business and pleasure.  This property did not meet my expectations.  Here is why:
Check in- Front desk sent me to room 703.  Problem was the room was a mess and a guest was in the room.  Back down to the front desk with my luggage.  Second attempt was room 609.  Food trays from breakfast were lining the hallway outside the room.  The room was clean and vacant to my relief but the elevator lobby had glasses and plates left by guests. Messy!
Coffee maker in room was broken.  Room was also hot and stuffy.  An engineer is summoned to the room to see why it was not working.  The explanation was the hotel turns off the a/c after 10/1.  He recommends opening the balcony door and the room front door and sleeping with the room door propped open.  I tell the engineer there is no way.  I did sleep with the window open but readers should know there is a hospital nearby and the sirens from the ambulances were disturbing.
Breakfest is the usual Embassy Suites and was good.  The property charges $15/night for parking in their lot.  Front staff knew little about the amenities and the neighborhood restaurants.

owner_response.author: SalesManager175, Manager at Embassy Suites by Hilton St. Paul - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Mikey-

Thank you for being a Hilton Loyalty Member, Choosing Embassy Suites Saint Paul-Downtown, and for your feedback.  We will be taking a look at the area's that were not up to standard and that lacked customer service. We are sorry you did not receive a better solution to the problem, and will be working with our staff to ensure that all of our guests needs are met and they always have an enjoyable time while traveling. Saint Paul has really developed and offers so many great local restaurants and attractions, and I am sorry you were not informed about them! We hope you give Saint Paul and the Embassy Suites Saint Paul-Downtown another chance.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great place!
data.text: The rooms are very stylish and clean...complimentary breakfast was deluxe and delicious; beds super comfortable, and staff were very kind and helpful, especially shuttle service as we had a disabled person and everyone was thoughtful and helpful in getting him transported.  Very enjoyable stay

data.title: St Paul Embassy Suites Review
data.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last two years, all in all this is a good hotel, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The morning complimentary breakfast is fantastic the cook is great, and the restaurant is also very good with great food. The rooms are your typical Embassy Suites rooms, but they should start thinking about upgrading the rooms.
